str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Perhaps from paio; a boy, or, a girl, and a child; specially, a slave or servant.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
